task_summary: Pick up the red object from the table using a robot arm and gripper, following perception, approach, and grasp steps verified by visual and contact feedback.

task_long_description.overview: In this episode, a robot arm is tasked with picking up a red cylindrical object that is placed on a flat black table alongside blue rectangular objects (distractors or other targets). The robot must perceive the location of the red object, approach from above, compute a suitable grasp pose, align precisely to the grasp, and close its gripper to acquire the object securely. The process involves checks and retries for perception and verifies successful pick via gripper feedback. The environment is uncluttered, allowing for clear visual detection and unobstructed access.
preconditions: Red object (cylinder) present on table within arm workspace
Robot arm and gripper are initialized and unobstructed
No objects blocking approach above red object
stepwise_plan: Verify visibility of the red object, retry scan if not found
Localize appearance using DetectObject for refined pose
Move above the perceived red object (pre-grasp pose)
Approach and align to target location with tight tolerance
Compute grasp pose (top strategy) and store
Execute grasp at computed pose using top strategy
success_criteria: Red object is firmly held in gripper
No collisions or lost grasp during pick-up
failure_and_recovery: Perception failure: Retry scan using fallback
Grasp failure: Indicated by missing object in gripper
Unexpected collision or slip: abort or retry sequence
task_long_description.termination: Upon confirmed grasp of red object by gripper

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: pick up the red object from the table

node_specs.description: Checks if red object is in camera view
Scans scene in grid pattern to find red object
Detects pose of red object more precisely
Approaches and aligns to grasp pose
Computes grasp pose using top-down strategy
Checks if object is held in gripper

failure_modes: Gripper fails to open or close
recovery_strategy: Abort or retry grasp if ObjectInGripper fails
assumptions: Red object in instruction refers to the red cylindrical object in all frames
Table is the workspace, not an explicit target for pickup
No explicit instruction on grasp forceâ€”left at null

expected_success_criteria: Red object detected, approached, aligned, and grasped securely
